DataElement.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to serologic tests to determine the presence of immunologic factors or evidence of an immune response._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion._The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants)._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
